section.title: Overview
section.para: ACE is an integral component of the Sparx XAF that allows for web-based application components discovery, documentation, and interactive testing. ACE is a servlet that is run inside the ServletContext of the owner application (as opposed to a separate ServletContext). So, ACE is always resident inside all Sparx applications unless it is removed for security or performance considerations. ACE is almost always available as http://server/appid/ace. For example, in the sample application web-cura it is reached by going to http://server/cura/ace.

The default username/password for ACE is ace/ace. The username and password are stored cleartext at this time in WEB-INF/configuration.xml (see the framework.ace.login.user-name and framework.ace.login.user-password).

section.title: Application Dialogs Page
section.para:
All dialogs defined in WEB-INF/ui/dialog.xml are listed in &explorer-name; under
Application Dialogs menu item.

section.title: Application Configuration Page
section.para:
All configuration items defined in WEB-INF/configuration.xml are listed in &explorer-name; under
Application Configurations menu item.

section.title: Application Servlet Context Page
section.para:
The servlet context items defined in WEB-INF/web.xml are listed in &explorer-name; under
Application Servlet Context menu item.

section.title: Application Access Control Page
section.para:
The permissions defined in WEB-INF/security/access-control.xml are listed in &explorer-name; under
Application Access Control menu item.
